channel.title: Christianity amp; Parenthood on Aggregated Thinking
channel.description: Recent content in Christianity amp; Parenthood on Aggregated Thinking

item.title: Valentine Surprise
item.description: Each year, on Valentine’s day, I usually surprise my darling wife with a letter/card, or a bouquet of roses. As it was a yearly thing, I knew she sort of expected these surprises; she’d look surprised, but I knew she wasn’t really.

item.title: Migs in the Office!
item.description: Miguel got real bored at home and wanted to go and meet his classmates. Since school doesn’t start until the 7th, I decided to take him with me to the office.

item.title: Civic Stories - December 2012
item.description: I sort of miss being in the backseat. A lot of my goofing off years have been conducted within the confines of the passenger doors, backside of the front seats, and the backseat.

item.title: Revisited: Blog changes, etc.
item.description: I’ve once more moved my blog. This time, it’s on my own hosting account and it’s back to using WP. Same blog, different flavor now and moving forward.

item.title: Honor God, Make Disciples
item.description: A couple of months ago, I started attending this workshop/training for leaders at Victory CDO. It’s called Training for Victory (T4V), and it was a once-a-week engagement for about 10 weeks; although it took longer than that because of several holidays around that time.

item.title: Kids on Photobooth
item.description: Miguel and Isabel goofing off in front of the laptop. They discovered the 4-shot option and started taking pictures by themselves.

item.title: Thank you!
item.description: I am home, and enjoying my second lease in life, one slow day at a time. I have never been hospitalized for something as life-threatening as DHF with complications before, so it’s a bit frustrating that even when I’m already out of the hospital, I could not move around as much as I want.

item.title: Miguel, lately.
item.description: Since we moved apartments, the little man started doing facial expressions that always gets us wondering how he got them. I’ve tried capturing these expressions with a camera but it’s a lot harder than simply having the phone or the point-and-shoot handy at all times.

item.title: Movin' on
item.description: Originally posted in my “other” blog. By the end of the month, I will be moving to the Queen City of the South, with my family in tow.
